body:
## Table of contents

[toc]

- - -

## Headers

#### Heading 4
##### Heading 5
###### Heading 6

- - -

## Bold

**This text is bold**
__This text is bold, too__

- - -

## Italic 

*This text is italic*
_This text is italic, too_

- - -

## Strikethrough

~~This text is strikethrough~~

- - -

## Inserted

++This text is inserted++

- - -

## Marked

==This text is marked==

- - -

## Abbreviation

This is HTML abbreviation example.
It converts "HTML", but keep intact partial entries like "xxxHTMLyyy" and so on.
*[HTML]: Hyper Text Markup Language

- - -

## List

### Unordered list

+ Create a list by starting a line with `+`, `-`, or `*`
+ Sub-lists are made by indenting 2 spaces:
  - Marker character change forces new list start:
    * Ac tristique libero volutpat at
    + Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet
    - Nulla volutpat aliquam velit
+ Very easy!

### Ordered list

1. Use `1` as start index. The next indexes can be set as `1`
1. The next indexes can be set as `1`.  

or 

10. Use a random number as start index.
11. The next indexes should be sequential.

- - -

## Horizontal Rules

___

or

---

or

***

## Blockquote

> Blockquotes can also be nested...
>> ...by using additional greater-than signs right next to each other...
> > > ...or with spaces between arrows.

- - -

## Block code fence

```
Sample text here...
```

- - -

## Inline code

There is an `inline-code` in this sentence.

## Link

[Google](https://www.google.com/)
Link with title (hover the link too see its title)
[Google](https://www.google.com/ "Search something")
or you can write a a link like this https://www.google.com/

- - -

## Image

![Minion](https://octodex.github.com/images/minion.png)

Image with title and size (hover the image too see its title)
![Stormtroopocat](https://octodex.github.com/images/stormtroopocat.jpg "The Stormtroopocat" =50x50)
- - -

## Table

| Tables   |      Are      |  Cool |
|----------|:-------------:|------:|
| col 1 is |  left-aligned | $1600 |
| col 2 is |    centered   |   $12 |
| col 3 is | right-aligned |    $1 |

- - -

## Alter

::: success
Nuclear missile launched.
:::

::: info
This is my number.
:::

::: warning
Someone is behind you.
:::

::: error
Do not text your ex.
:::

- - -

## Definition list

Term 1
  ~ Definition 1

Term 2
  ~ Definition 2a
  ~ Definition 2b

## ASCII Math

```ASCIIMath
Inline AsciiMath: `@(1/2[1-(1/2)^n])/(1-(1/2))=s_n@`

oint_Cx^3 dx+4y^2 dy

2=(((3-x)xx2)/(3-x))

sum_(m=1)^oosum_(n=1)^oo(m^2 n)/(3^m(m3^n+n3^m)
```
- - -

## Subcription

H~2~O
You can also use inline math: `$H_2O$`

- - -

## Superscript

29^th^
You can also use inline math: `$29^{th}$`

- - -

## Emoji

:panda_face: :sparkles: :camel: :boom: :pig:
:-) :-( 8-) ;)

- - -

## Footnote

Footnote 1 link[^first].
Footnote 2 link[^second].
Inline footnote^[Text of inline footnote] definition.
Duplicated footnote reference[^second].
[^first]: Footnote **can have markup**
    and multiple paragraphs.
[^second]: Footnote text.

---

title: Demo with markdown
description: A long post with all markdown syntaxes
